body.p: Each WebHelp Publishing Template includes a descriptor file which defines the meta-data associated with template. It is an XML file that defines all the resources included by a template like HTML page templates, CSS, JS, fonts, transformation parameters.
The template descriptor file should have the .opt extension (debugger.opt) and it should be located in the root folder associated with the template.
body.codeblock:
<publishing-template> <name>Flowers</name> <tags> <tag>tree</tag> <tag>light</tag> </tags>
<webhelp> <preview-image file="flowers-tree.png"/>
<!-- Resources like CSS, favicon, logo and others --> <resources> <!-- Main CSS file --> <css file="flowers.css"/>
<!-- Copy resources to output folder --> <fileset> <include name="resources/**/*"/> <exclude name="resources/**/.svn"/> <exclude name="resources/**/.git"/> </fileset> </resources>
<parameters> <parameter name="webhelp.show.main.page.tiles" value="no"/> <parameter name="webhelp.show.main.page.toc" value="yes"/> <parameter name="webhelp.top.menu.depth" value="3"/> </parameters> </webhelp> </publishing-template>
body.note: It is recommended to edit the template descriptor in the oXygen XML editor to get content completion and validation.
